item.title: Automated certificate management in local Kubernetes clusters, with local domains
item.description: Overview / Requirements / Setup After setting up external-dns and cert-manager for the hundreth time I thought it’d be fun to add some functionality to my homelab cluster and have proper signed certs there. This blog post is a basic outline of how to setup cert-manager to sign certificates using a certificate and key provided from an intermediary CA. I’m using pfSense to both provide DNS to my .lan domain and generate the root and intermediary CA certs, you can use whatever platform you’d like but the steps outlined here use pfSense.
